snippet.title: Nike severs relationship with Lance Armstrong's Livestrong Foundation
snippet.description:
Nike severs relationship with Lance Armstrong's Livestrong Foundation by Peter Berkes on May 28 2013, 12:51p
The shoe giant, which has helped to raise money and awareness for Lance Armstrong's charity, will no longer be working with them going forward.

snippet.title: Lance Armstrong sued over USPS sponsorship
snippet.description:
Lance Armstrong sued over USPS sponsorship by Griffin Gotta on Apr 23 2013, 8:52p
The U.S. government no longer sees those millions of sponsorship dollars as well-spent.

snippet.title: Lance Armstrong refuses to comply with USADA wishes for full debrief
snippet.description:
Lance Armstrong refuses to comply with USADA wishes for full debrief by JP Starkey on Feb 20 2013, 3:16p
Lance Armstrong once again refused to comply with the USADA, as he refused to submit a debrief to the anti-doping agency, which would detail how the famed cyclist was able to cheat for so long.

snippet.title: Lance Armstrong sued for $12 million by insurance company
snippet.description:
Lance Armstrong sued for $12 million by insurance company by James Dator on Feb 7 2013, 11:37p
An insurance company is trying to recover bonuses they paid to the disgraced cyclist.

snippet.title: In defense of Jay Cutler, a heel America should get behind
snippet.description:
In defense of Jay Cutler, a heel America should get behind by Ricky O'Donnell on Feb 7 2013, 12:52p
A recent poll named Jay Cutler America's fourth-most disliked athlete. This is tragic. Jay Cutler is a heel worthy of appreciation.

snippet.title: Manti Te'o hoax: Katie Couric TV interview set for Thursday
snippet.description:
Manti Te'o hoax: Katie Couric TV interview set for Thursday by Asher Feldman on Jan 20 2013, 1:58p
ABC News's Katie Couric reportedly scores the first televised sit-down interview with the Notre Dame linebacker at the center of an apparent hoax.

snippet.title: Lance Armstrong may have lied during interview, per report
snippet.description:
Lance Armstrong may have lied during interview, per report by Adam Stites on Jan 18 2013, 6:21p
Although he admitted to the use of performance-enhancers, there is a discrepancy between investigators and Armstrong's claims regarding the 2009 Tour de France.

snippet.title: Nike 'saddened' by Lance Armstrong's doping confession
snippet.description:
Nike 'saddened' by Lance Armstrong's doping confession by Ryan Rosenblatt on Jan 18 2013, 1:24p
Nike has further distanced themselves from Armstrong, saying they are "saddened" for being misled, but will continue to support the Livestrong Foundation.

snippet.title: Lance Armstrong interview: USADA says cyclist should 'testify under oath'
snippet.description:
Lance Armstrong interview: USADA says cyclist should 'testify under oath' by Matt Conner on Jan 17 2013, 11:49p
The United States Anti-Doping Agency has some specific actions for Armstrong if he is to work his way back into good graces.

snippet.title: Lance Armstrong interview: 'I see the anger in people'
snippet.description:
Lance Armstrong interview: 'I see the anger in people' by Peter Berkes on Jan 17 2013, 10:32p
Armstrong sat down with Oprah for a tell-all interview, exposing his use of performance enhancing drugs. Here's a selection of quotes from that interview.
